verses.verse: If you afflict them in any way, and they ((Luke 18:7)) cry at all to Me, I will surely (Deut. 10:17, 18; Ps. 18:6) hear their cry;
and My (Ps. 69:24) wrath will become hot, and I will kill you with the sword; (Ps. 109:9) your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.

(Lev. 25:35-37) “If you lend money to any of My people who are poor among you, you shall not be like a moneylender to him; you shall not charge him (Deut. 23:19, 20; Neh. 5:1-13; Ps. 15:5; Ezek. 18:8) interest.
(Deut. 24:6, 10-13; Job 24:3; Prov. 20:16; Amos 2:8) If you ever take your neighbor’s garment as a pledge, you shall return it to him before the sun goes down.
For that is his only covering, it is his garment for his skin. What will he sleep in? And it will be that when he cries to Me, I will hear, for I am (Ex. 34:6, 7) gracious.
(Eccl. 10:20) “You shall not revile God, nor curse a (Acts 23:5) ruler of your people.
“You shall not delay to offer (Ex. 23:16, 19; Deut. 26:2-11; Prov. 3:9) the first of your ripe produce and your juices. (Ex. 13:2, 12, 15) The firstborn of your sons you shall give to Me.
(Deut. 15:19) Likewise you shall do with your oxen and your sheep. It shall be with its mother (Lev. 22:27) seven days; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.
“And you shall be (Ex. 19:6; Lev. 11:44; 19:2) holy men to Me: (Lev. 7:24; 17:15; Ezek. 4:14) you shall not eat meat torn by beasts in the field; you shall throw it to the dogs.

Justice for All “You (Ex. 20:16; Lev. 19:11; Deut. 5:20; Ps. 101:5; (Prov. 10:18)) shall not circulate a false report. Do not put your hand with the wicked to be an (Deut. 19:16-21; Ps. 35:11; (Prov. 19:5); Acts 6:11) unrighteous witness.
(Gen. 7:1) You shall not follow a crowd to do evil; (Lev. 19:15) nor shall you testify in a dispute so as to turn aside after many to pervert justice.
You shall not show partiality to a (Ex. 23:6; Lev. 19:15; Deut. 1:17; 16:19) poor man in his dispute.
((Rom. 12:20)) “If you meet your enemy’s ox or his donkey going astray, you shall surely bring it back to him again.
(Deut. 22:4) If you see the donkey of one who hates you lying under its burden, and you would refrain from helping it, you shall surely help him with it.
(Eccl. 5:8) “You shall not pervert the judgment of your poor in his dispute.
(Ex. 20:16; Ps. 119:29; Eph. 4:25) Keep yourself far from a false matter; (Matt. 27:4) do not kill the innocent and righteous. For (Ex. 34:7; Deut. 25:1; Rom. 1:18) I will not justify the wicked.

And (Deut. 10:17; 16:19; Prov. 15:27; 17:8, 23; Is. 5:22, 23) you (Ex. 22:21; Lev. 19:33; Deut. 24:17; 27:19) shall take no bribe, for a bribe blinds the discerning and perverts the words of the righteous.
“Also you shall not oppress a stranger, for you know the heart of a stranger, because you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
The Law of Sabbaths (Lev. 25:1-7) “Six years you shall sow your land and gather in its produce,

but the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of your people may eat; and what they leave, the beasts of the field may eat. In like manner you shall do with your vineyard and your olive grove.
(Luke 13:14) Six days you shall do your work, and on the seventh day you shall rest, that your ox and your donkey may rest, and the son of your female servant and the stranger may be refreshed.
“And in all that I have said to you, (Deut. 4:9, 23; 1 Tim. 4:16) be circumspect and (Josh. 23:7; Ps. 16:4; Hos. 2:17) make no mention of the name of other gods, nor let it be heard from your mouth.
Three Annual Feasts (Ex. 23:17; 34:22-24; Deut. 16:16) “Three times you shall keep a feast to Me in the year:

(Ex. 12:14-20; Lev. 23:6-8; Num. 28:16-25) You shall keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread (you shall eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month of Abib, for in it you came out of Egypt; (Ex. 22:29; 34:20) none shall appear before Me empty);

(Ex. 34:22; Lev. 23:10; Num. 28:26) and (Deut. 16:13) the Feast of Harvest, the firstfruits of your labors which you have sown in the field; and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you have gathered in the fruit of your labors from the field.
(Ex. 23:14; 34:23; Deut. 16:16) “Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord GOD.
(Ex. 34:25; Lev. 2:11) “You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with (Ex. 12:10; Lev. 7:15; Deut. 16:4) leavened bread; nor shall the fat of My sacrifice remain until morning.

(Ex. 22:29; 34:26; Deut. 26:2, 10; Neh. 10:35; Prov. 3:9) The first of the firstfruits of your land you shall bring into the house of the LORD your God. (Deut. 14:21) You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
The Angel and the Promises (Ex. 3:2; 13:15; 14:19; Josh. 5:14) “Behold, I send an Angel before you to keep you in the way and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.

Beware of Him and obey His voice; (Num. 14:11; Deut. 9:7; Ps. 78:40, 56) do not provoke Him, for He will (Deut. 18:19; 1 John 5:16) not pardon your transgressions; for (Is. 9:6; Jer. 23:6) My name is in Him.
But if you indeed obey His voice and do all that I speak, then (Gen. 12:3; Num. 24:9; Deut. 30:7; Jer. 30:20) I will be an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries.

(Ex. 23:20) For My Angel will go before you and (Josh. 24:8, 11) bring you in to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites and the Canaanites and the Hivites and the Jebusites; and I will cut them off.

You shall not (Ex. 20:5; 23:13, 33) bow down to their gods, nor serve them, (Deut. 12:30, 31) nor do according to their works; (Ex. 34:13; Num. 33:52; Deut. 7:5; 12:3; 2 Kin. 18:4) but you shall utterly overthrow them and completely break down their sacred pillars.
